com.informix.asf

Class IfxDataOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • com.informix.asf.IfxDataOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IfxDebugDataOutputStream

    public class IfxDataOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream
    This class is the Informix OutputStream class to write the informix datatypes to an OutputStream, throws an IOException in case of error.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int written
      The number of bytes written to the outputstream.
      Make sure that variable byteCountAtEOT remains of same type as that of written

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.FilterOutputStream

        out

      • writeWithMangledTrace

        public void writeWithMangledTrace(byte[] b)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        In this class , the implementation is same as Same as write (byte b []) method. Used to write bytes which we don't want to log in trace file. such as password bytes. See implementation of this method in IfxDebugDataOutputStream which mangles bytes before writing to trace file.
        Parameters:
        b -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writePadded

        public void writePadded(byte[] b)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        writes a byte array to the outputstream. Adds a pad byte if the length is odd.
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to write to the outputstream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case an I/O error occurs.

      • getJavaToIfx4BytesChar

        public byte[] getJavaToIfx4BytesChar(java.lang.String s,
                            java.lang.String dbenc)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.sql.SQLException
        returns a byte array of the given string, conversion routine should be used for servers that have removed 64K Limit, conversion is done based on given dbencoding option. IFX_USE_STRENC connection property if set would be used by this method during conversion.
        Parameters:
        s - String to convert
        dbenc - db locale encoding to use.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setByteCntAtEOT

        public void setByteCntAtEOT()
        This is to be called after SQ_EOT is sent every time . This stores number of bytes written at time this method was called in an integer variable byteCountAtEOT

      • getBytesSentSinceLastEOT

        public int getBytesSentSinceLastEOT()
        Returns:
        int giving number of bytes written to stream since last SQ_EOT was sent to the server

        protected void clearTrace()
